newsitem.title: USA: Dynamics says directors call bid inadequate.
newsitem.headline: Dynamics says directors call bid inadequate.

text.p: Dynamics Corp of America said Monday the "unanimous initial reaction" of its directors to WHX Corp's $40 a share cash merger offer, except for one who could not be reached, was that it was "totally inadequate."

In a statement, Dynamics confirmed it received the unsolicited offer on March 27. It said it acknowledged receipt of WHX's letter-offer on the same day and advised WHX it would inform its directors and respond this week.
Dynamics said it was suggesting to its shareholders that they withhold taking any action on the offer pending further developments.

WHX, a holding company whose principal subsidiary is Wheeling-Pittsburgh Steel Corp, publicly announced its unsolicited offer earlier Monday. It valued the offer at $160 million, but said it was prepared to raise the price if it got data from Dynamics that warranted a higher bid.

Dynamics makes electronic components, mobile vans and transportable shelters for specialized electronic and medical diagnostic equipment. It also makes portable electric housewares and commercial appliances, air distribution equipment, specialized air-conditioning equipment and generator sets.
It holds a 44.1 percent stake in CTS Corp, which makes electronic and electromechanical components.
